children.teaser: Students apply what they have learned in previous lessons in their independent task

children.title: Independent Research: The Challenges To Having Enough Clean Water
children.teaser: This lesson formally launches student research in the unit.

children.title: Continued Independent Research
children.teaser: The Challenges to Having Enough Clean Water for Everyone

children.title: Completing Independent Research
children.teaser: Students research their topic, identifying questions and challenges.

children.title: End Of Unit Assessment: On-Demand Writing
children.teaser: End of Unit Assessment: On-Demand Writing to Inform Readers about Challenges to Having Enough Clean Water

children.title: Gathering Evidence And Speaking To Others
children.teaser: Students develop an opinion on should be done to ensure that everyone has access to clean water.

children.title: Reading Closely To Become “Well Aware”: Launching Our Performance Task
children.teaser: This lesson officially launches students’ work on their final performance task.

children.title: Determining The Main Idea And Key Details: “Dry Days In Australia
children.teaser: Students listen to a complex text read-aloud to access content and hear fluent reading of new terms.

children.title: Main Idea And Key Details: “Tackling The Trash”
children.teaser: Students determine the Main Idea and Key Details for “Tackling the Trash”

children.title: Main Idea And Key Details: “Ryan Hreljac: The Boy Who Built A Well”
children.teaser: Students determine the main idea and key details of “Ryan Hreljac: The Boy Who Built a Well”

children.title: What’s One Thing We Should Do?
children.teaser: Students engage in discussion circles to address the question: What’s One Thing We Should Do?

children.title: Mid-Unit 3 Assessment: On-Demand Opinion Writing
children.teaser: Students engage in on-demand opinion writing about what they believe should be done to ensure clean water

children.title: Crafting Your Voice thread PSA Script: Strengthening Reasons
children.teaser: As students craft their voice thread, they focus on strengthening support for their opinions.

children.title: Crafting Your Voice thread PSA Script: Organizing Your Ideas
children.teaser: Students organize their ideas logically to send a clear message as they craft their script.

children.title: Crafting Your Voice Thread PSA Script
children.teaser: Students identify facts and details to support the message they want to convey.

children.title: Preparing To Record Your Voice thread PSA Script
children.teaser: Students prepare their scripts paying attention to the difference between spoken and written text.

children.title: Crafting Your Voicethread PSA Script
children.teaser: Students address speaking criteria and develop hooks for their scripts.

children.title: End Of Unit 3 Assessment
children.teaser: Students practice and present their voice thread recordings.

children.title: End Of Unit 3 Assessment, Continued
children.teaser: Students continue with the final assessment: Presenting Your Voice Thread PSA Script and Giving Feedback
